name: Totó la Momposina
description: '''Sonia Bazanta Vides''' (born 1 August 1940), better known as '''Totó la Momposina''', is a Colombian singer of [[Afro-Colombian]] and Indigenous descent. She reached international attention with the release of her 1993 album ''[[La Candela Viva]]'' on [[Peter Gabriel]]'s [[Real World Records]] label. Totó accompanied [[Gabriel García Márquez]] to receive the [[Nobel Prize in Literature]] in 1982 as part of a Colombian cultural delegation performing during the award ceremony.
